sectors.name: Defence
sectors.description: Defence budget focused on indigenous manufacturing under 'Make in India', covering capital acquisition, revenue expenditure, and defence pensions. Emphasis on modernization and border infrastructure.

schemes.name: Capital Outlay
schemes.description: Modernization of armed forces including acquisition of fighter jets, naval vessels, submarines, and artillery systems.

schemes.name: Defence Pensions
schemes.description: Pension payments for retired defence personnel including OROP (One Rank One Pension) implementation.

schemes.name: Revenue Expenditure
schemes.description: Salaries, maintenance, training, and operational expenses of armed forces.

policies: Defence Industrial Corridors established in Tamil Nadu and Uttar Pradesh.
FDI liberalization in defence sector up to 74% under automatic route.
Strategic Partnership Model for indigenous defence manufacturing.
Defence Procurement Procedure 2016 implementation for transparency.

sectors.name: Agriculture
sectors.description: Historic allocation for agriculture sector. Major focus on direct income transfer to farmers through PM-KISAN, providing ₹6,000 annually to small and marginal farmers. Continued emphasis on doubling farmers' income by 2022.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN)
schemes.description: Direct income support of ₹6,000 per year to small and marginal farmer families through three equal installments.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
schemes.description: Crop insurance scheme providing insurance coverage and financial support to farmers in case of crop failure.

schemes.name: Interest Subvention Scheme
schemes.description: Short-term crop loans up to ₹3 lakh at subsidized interest rate of 7%, with additional 3% subvention for timely repayment.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana
schemes.description: Expanding irrigation coverage with focus on 'Per Drop More Crop' through micro-irrigation.

schemes.name: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana (RKVY)
schemes.description: State-level agriculture development planning and implementation support.

policies: MSP fixed at minimum 1.5 times the production cost for all Kharif and Rabi crops.
Formation of 10,000 new Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs) over 5 years.
Agricultural credit target set at ₹13.5 lakh crore for FY 2019-20.
Zero Budget Natural Farming promotion in Andhra Pradesh and other states.
E-NAM (National Agriculture Market) expansion to 585 mandis for unified agricultural market.

sectors.name: Education
sectors.description: Total allocation to Ministry of Human Resource Development covering school education, higher education, and skill development. Focus on improving quality, access, and equity in education.

schemes.name: Samagra Shiksha Abhiyan
schemes.description: Integrated scheme for school education from pre-school to Class 12, subsuming earlier schemes like SSA, RMSA, and Teacher Training.

schemes.name: Mid-Day Meal Scheme
schemes.description: Providing nutritious meals to students in government schools to improve enrollment and attendance.

schemes.name: Higher Education Financing
schemes.description: Support to central universities, IITs, IIMs, NITs, IISERs, and other institutions of higher learning.

schemes.name: Scholarship Programs (SC/ST/OBC/Minority)
schemes.description: Pre-matric and post-matric scholarships for students from disadvantaged communities.

schemes.name: PM Research Fellows (PMRF) Scheme
